argument.name: LoadedImageName
argument.description: The name of a bitmap object created with UI_BITMAP_LOAD().

page.description: The OLE.CreatePicture() function creates a IPictureDisp object.
page.discussion: Create an OLE picture object from an image previously loaded by calling ui_bitmap_load().

section.title: Example
section.description: This is part of the code used to create and load an image to display behind a pie chart in a SimpleChart ActiveX control.
section.example: dim b as B ' Load a bitmap into a blob variable b = file.to_blob("somebitmapfile.bmp") ' Load the binary data into the Alpha Anywhere bitmap cache ui_bitmap_load("image_name", b) ' Create the IPictureDisp object you need x = OLE.createPicture("image_name") .BackImage = x

page.original:
OLE.CreatePicture() Syntax as P = OLE.CreatePicture( Image_Name as C ) ArgumentDescription A pointer to the OLE object. Image_NameThe name of a bitmap object created with UI_BITMAP_LOAD().
Description The OLE.CreatePicture() function creates a IPictureDisp object. Examples This is part of the code used to create and load an image to display behind a pie chart in a SimpleChart ActiveX control. dim b as B ' Load a bitmap into a blob variable b = file.to_blob("somebitmapfile.bmp") ' Load the binary data into the Alpha Anywhere bitmap cache ui_bitmap_load("image_name", b) ' Create the IPictureDisp object you need x = OLE.createPicture("image_name") .BackImage = x
See Also OLE and ActiveX Methods
